chapter_title: 6. Therefore the skillful leader subdues the enemy’s
claims: The skillful leader subdues the enemy's town without fighting.
The skillful leader captures cities without laying siege to them.
The skillful leader overthrows kingdoms without lengthy operations in the field.
rules: If our forces are ten to the enemy’s one, we surround him.
If five to one, we attack him.
If twice as numerous, we divide our army into two.
If equally matched, we can offer battle.
If slightly inferior in numbers, we can avoid the enemy.
If quite unequal in every way, we can flee from him.
